title: 109_hr4318
content: The "Outer Continental Shelf Natural Gas Relief Act" terminates prohibitions on expenditures for offshore gas leasing and revokes withdrawals of Federal submerged lands for leasing. It also establishes an Outer Continental Shelf leasing program. SEC. 10. STATE APPROVAL REQUIREMENT WITH RESPECT TO GAS LEASING. The Secretary cannot grant gas leases within 20 miles of a state's coastline without the Governor's approval. Additionally, at least 75% of available unleased acreage must be offered for gas leasing in each 5-year program on the Outer Continental Shelf. The Secretary must adhere to the 5-year Outer Continental Shelf gas leasing program and offer 75% of unleased acreage for leasing. SEC. 4. SHARING OF REVENUES. Section 8(g) of the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act is amended to allocate bonus bids and royalties from new Federal gas leases on submerged lands to States, with 40 percent going to the State and 10 percent available for other uses. 10 percent of amounts received by the United States from bonus bids and royalties under existing Federal gas leases on submerged lands within State boundaries will be paid to the State. In the second full fiscal year after enactment, 20 percent of amounts received will be paid, in the third year 30 percent, and in the fourth year and beyond 40 percent. For leased tracts partially within a state's seaward boundaries, bonus bids and royalties are subject to the same percentages. The percentage of bonus bids and royalties from tracts within a state's seaward boundaries is based on the surface acreage percentage. Definitions for existing and new federal gas leases are provided. The text discusses the establishment of state seaward boundaries for federal gas leases granted after a specific date. It also mentions the application of bonus bids and royalties received by the United States after a certain date. The text discusses the establishment of state seaward boundaries for federal gas leases granted after a specific date in various OCS planning areas. SEC. 5. NATURAL GAS-ONLY LEASING. Section 8 of the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act is amended to allow the Secretary to issue leases for the development and production of natural gas and associated condensate. Regulations must be established to define natural gas, condensate, and oil, as well as outline the lessee's rights and obligations regarding condensate production. The Secretary can issue leases for natural gas and condensate production under the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act. Regulations will define rights and obligations for lessees, including restrictions on development for existing oil and gas leases. The Secretary may restrict development under a lease to natural gas and associated condensate only, without amending the outer Continental shelf leasing program. Public notice and comment are required for natural gas-only leases issued before June 30, 2007. The Secretary can also include provisions for natural gas-only leases in the leasing program for the 5-year period starting in 2007. The Secretary can restrict lease development to natural gas and condensate without amending the leasing program. Public notice and comment are required for natural gas-only leases issued before June 30, 2007. Provisions for natural gas-only leases can be included in the leasing program for the 5-year period starting in 2007.
